summary: The "European citizens' initiative" is a unique legal mechanism within the EU framework that empowers citizens to directly influence the legislative agenda of the European Commission. Established under the Treaty of Lisbon, this initiative allows one million EU citizens from a significant number of Member States to propose new legislation. It serves as a vital tool for participatory democracy, enabling citizens to engage actively in the European construction process. As a redirect to the preferred term, it underscores the importance of citizen involvement in shaping EU policies, ensuring that the voices of the populace are heard in the regulatory landscape.
